resources.string: Flashlight flickering time on Call incoming
Flashlight flickering time on SMS incoming
Flashlight flickering time on Battery Power reached
Flashlight flickering time on Altitude Height reached
Find below full description\nof each service and its icons.
Click the red/green button in the flashlight to turn On and Off the phone\'s flashlight.\n\nYou can also Press+Hold and Release the button to turn the flashlight On and Off as well on demand.

Phone\'s battery power shall be monitored and you will get notified by flashlight flickering when the power level you \'ve specified is reached.\n\nWhen that happens, the flashlight will be flickering for 15 seconds (default).
Service has no rights by User to function.
Set the time at which you want to get notified by flashlight flickering.\n\nWhen time is reached, the flashlight will be flickering for 15 seconds (default).
Enable this service to continuously transmit SOS message in Morse code from your flashlight

You can turn On and Off the flashlight by producing short sounds, e.g. finger–snapping and hand–clapping. 

Note that you can configure the sound sensitivity at the desired level (1 to 10).

Service is only available if you permit Audio rights to @Flashii. If otherwise, the deactivated button is displayed instead.

Enable this service to get notified by flashlight flickering when you receive an incoming SMS in your phone. 

Flickering will stop after 15 seconds (configurable in Settings).

Service is only available if you permit SMS rights to @Flashii. If otherwise, the deactivated button is displayed instead.

Enable this service to get notified by flashlight flickering when you receive an incoming Call on your phone.

Flickering will stop if you answer or reject the incoming Call, or automatically after 15 seconds (configurable in Settings).

Service is only available if you permit Call rights to @Flashii. If otherwise, the deactivated button is displayed instead.

You can turn On and Off the flashlight by tilting the phone at around 80 degrees angle (default) from its standpoint. You can manually configure this angle between 45° - 90° in the seekbar.\n\nService is only available if your phone device has a Rotation Sensor. If otherwise, the deactivated button is displayed instead.

Flashlight will be flickering at the frequency in Hertz (Hz) you specify in the seekbar. By default frequency ranges from 1 to 10Hz.\n\nNote that you can configure the max frequency of 10Hz to the desired value in the Settings (up to 100Hz).

Set a specific Altitude height in meters (m) at which you want to get notified by flashlight flickering.

When Altitude is reached, the flashlight will be flickering for 15 seconds (default).

Service is only available if you permit Location rights to @Flashii. If otherwise, the deactivated button is displayed instead.

Based on your phone's current internet connection status, you 'll get notified by flashlight flickering when

a) internet Data or WiFi connections are lost, 
b) internet Data or WiFi connections are found.
Get notified when Data or WiFi are lost
Get notified when Data or WiFi are found
